intro: Fagelia divaricata, commonly known as the variegated fagelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with shades of green, white, and yellow. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
